alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Gulf and northwestern Franklin Counties through 615 PM EDT/515 PM CDT/... At 512 PM EDT/412 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Apalachicola, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastpoint, Franklin, Buck Siding, High Bluff, Howard Creek, Creels, Beverly, Hays Place, Green Point and Fort Gadsden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf
